segments.text: The whole scene is like a snapshot of childhood mischief and neglect.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t quite shake the feeling that something is going to end badly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is still pouring over the edge, and it’s like a ticking clock.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Despite the sense of impending doom, I feel a little thrill watching the children.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think about all the little moments that make up a day like this; it’s surreal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And yet, there’s something so bittersweet about it, knowing they’re up to no good.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I keep wanting to intervene, but I also want to let them enjoy their moment.
segments.speaker: PAR
